Scooters: Scooters are a great alternative to bicycles for short distances. They are easy to maneuver, can carry more weight than a bicycle, and can be parked in smaller spaces. Some cities even have scooter-sharing programs that allow you to rent a scooter for a short period of time.

Electric skateboards: Electric skateboards are another option for getting around without a car. They are easy to use and can be a fun way to travel short distances. They are also environmentally friendly and can be easily stored in small spaces.

Public transportation: If you need to travel longer distances, public transportation such as buses, trains, and subways can be a great option. These modes of transportation can be more expensive than owning a car, but they can save you money on fuel, maintenance, and parking fees.

Carpooling: Carpooling with friends or colleagues can be a great way to get around without a car. You can split the cost of fuel and parking, and it can also be a fun way to socialize and meet new people.

Bike-sharing programs: Many cities have bike-sharing programs that allow you to rent a bicycle for a short period of time. These programs are usually affordable and provide bikes in various locations throughout the city.
